annotation.TEXT: Ooh! Even with only one-third of my life left, I managed to break 10,000 points this time! If you finish a stage on Hard mode with 100% life, and don't destroy anything that you're not supposed to, you can score a maximum of 15,000 points (plus whatever little increases to your score that happened to occur during the stage).
And here we go, against... a writing table?! Well, whatever. It's attacking Flandre, so let's beat it up!
Flee and maybe barrel roll until my shield comes back.
And I've cleared this before with a non-zero percentage showing there, and the image showed both Marisa and Flandre tied up, so I don't know why it screwed up the math this time... Oh, well.
...Um, what? I destroyed the writing table, but the stage didn't end? Am I remembering the clear conditions of this stage wrong?
Oh, and don't worry about enemy attacks destroying stuff on you. Only your own attacks can destroy objects.
Well, I guess I didn't do too badly... Let's move on to stage 3.
Bam! That takes care of Marisa! But... Is the stage not over yet? I thought Marisa was the actual stage boss here. Maybe I still have to destroy the writing table...
Whoa! Where did my shield and life go so quickly? I need another heart or two, fast!
Bah. I broke a light fixture by accident. Well, that's only 2% damage by itself.

Oh, by the way, you see that "shot" counter up there? Well, if you press Z, you fire these tiny green shots that don't consume magic in the direction you're facing. If you run out of "shot", it will reload after a few seconds.
Oh, and it appears that you can start fighting right away, without having to wait for the dialog to end first.
Now, you guys might be wondering what the Normal and Hard difficulties are like. Well, I'm not going to play the entire game on those difficulties, but I will do stage 1 on them.
And, one hit later, the writing table bites it. It must've been frozen at 1 HP or something while Marisa was present, and then I had to finish it off after beating Marisa to end the stage.
That one... more than nicked my shield... Yikes!
This still unlocks stage 2, but I'm going to repeat stage 1 and try to beat the default high score of 1000. I should be able to by keeping the overall library damage below 45%.

Now, as you shoot lasers, your magic (shown in the upper-right) gets consumed, but it does gradually recover over time. Also, as you take hits, your shield (shown in the top-center) decreases, but that too also gradually regenerates.
I am seriously about to die here.
What is shooting those missiles anyway? Or are they just spawning randomly?
Alright, so to move Flandre around, move the mouse cursor, and she'll follow after it.
However, unlike stage 3, I don't have to wait around forever while killing mooks. The boss battle starts shortly after the stage begins, and it is against...
Demo count: 2
Oh, sometimes I shoot out these rotating cross lasers (like in the "Counter Clock" spell Flandre uses in EoSD), and I think those come out while I'm clicking rapidly in the circle or something.
I could've broken 10K if I caused no damage or I finished with more life, but that's okay.
If your shield breaks, try to take evasive action until it comes back.
I hate it when I'm down to the last few pieces of trash and am wandering around trying to find them...

Okay, the writing table is dead, and I finish with 11% destruction. Seems worse than the 2% from before. However, on the higher difficulties, your life bonus is higher. On Easy, it's 500 x life remaining. But on Normal, it's 2000 x life remaining.
That's phase two down. But, there's still one phase left to go. Marisa's still gotta show off her Master Spark!
Also, let's pay more attention to our shields and take evasive action when necessary!
Now, just like the first two stages, we're back to trashing trash here, which is what I'd prefer to be doing. However, the enemy attacks have gotten more fierce.
Or, let's almost die once again...
Shift key in action here. Although I'm probably not going to use this function too much.
Well, I hope you all enjoyed watching me play Sweeping Murder! See ya!
Well, that one went down much more easily than usual! But, still... The stage isn't over yet?
At least I stumbled upon a heart back there.
Ouch! I didn't do a very good job fleeing there. Maybe I should look for a heart or two.
Ooh. Finished with full life, and 21% damage isn't terrible.

Oh, but I still did worse than the 9900 that I got before. Oh, well. Also, the "destruction" bonus is always 10,000 - 20,000 x destruction caused (10,000 if 0%, 0 if 50%, and -10,000 if 100%), regardless of difficulty.
And I was doing so well last time too, with 0% destruction going into the writing table fight... Maybe if I was less careless, and paid more attention to my shield and life bars...

One more thing about the controls: If you hold the Shift key, you'll maintain your current course and speed, regardless of where you move the mouse. Could be helpful if you want to shoot at something behind you without changing direction.

Well, anyway, the table is destroyed, and the stage is cleared! However, I did rather poor score-wise, because the higher the blue percentage is, the LOWER you score, and it can actually go negative if the blue number is over 50%. (However, this game doesn't display a minus sign for some reason. I actually scored -1390 there.)
Shields are down, captain! Be careful!

Oh, yeah. There's this little "Del" key in the upper-left corner of the title screen, and I'm assuming that clicking that will erase your progress and high scores, but I'm not actually going to try it now.
Okay, well, let's get started!
Now for Hard mode!
The amount of trash left to destroy in the room is indicated by the pink percentage in the lower-left. The amount of other objects you've destroyed is shown by the blue percentage down there.

Now, there are five stages to this game, and you play them one at a time. You have to clear each stage to unlock the next. I think I'll start off on "Easy" mode, since things can get quite hectic during play.
Sometimes hearts can be found in miscellaneous objects...
Okay, maybe I should forget about the writing table and start attacking Marisa.
Wow... Well, that happened. My life bar went from full to empty so quickly! These enemies don't kid around, even on Easy!
Those green shots can be useful if you're low on magic or you're trying to avoid causing too much collateral damage. Okay, now let's take out this writing table and finish the stage again.
Oh, there it is! (I wonder if it's time-based in this stage instead.) Okay, now let's trash that thing!
Now, I believe that on the higher difficulties, the enemy attacks are more intense and hurt more, but I don't know if there are any other gameplay differences.

Now, this stage is different. You'll notice that there's no pink percentage this time, and there's no trash to destroy. I think you simply have to destroy enough enemies to cause a writing table to appear, and then destroy that to finish the stage.
Okay, I found a heart.
Peppy: "Do a barrel roll!" (X once.)
Bam! Got her!
Alright, let's move on to stage 2.
Man, I also wish there was a counter (at least for this stage) that showed how many more enemies I had to slay to summon the writing table.
Okay, now let's try this again, with less death this time...
Now, I did some looking around, and I found that somebody had translated the manual, and I've put that all in the video description.
If you click on these things down here, they take you to separate web pages (maybe where you can find this game's BGM, etc.), but I'm not going to show that here.
Well, there's another writing table. Maybe I have to destroy more than one?
Okay, that table's dead, so let's resume wrecking the place!

...Marisa?! What are you doing here? Also, it appears that a writing table appeared at the same time. Yeah, the writing table can actually appear at almost any time in a stage if you destroy enough enemies. However, beating it then won't clear the stage.
Whee, whee, whee. I got nothing better to do while I wait for enemies to show up...

If you destroy non-trash objects (like bookcases and light fixtures), items will appear. Blue star items give you some magic back, and a red heart restores about 50% of your life bar, which could be nice if you've taken a beating.
Alright, stage 4 cleared with only 5% destruction. That's not bad.
Alright, it's boss time! ...Against another writing table... Well, that's fine. Let's just trash it and move on.
Also, the enemies know how to aim at you and even know how to lead their shots, so you kind of have to keep changing course to avoid becoming swiss cheese.
Also, you've got enemies attacking you at times. They don't count towards either percentage, but you can destroy them to shut them up.
Whoa. I kind of slaughtered that bookshelf.

Okay, I'm just going to say right now that that isn't correct. My damage ratings for each stage were 2%, 25%, 100%, 5%, and 21%, which averages out to 30.6%, so I would've expected to see it display 30% or 31% here. It must've glitched something up in the damage calculation or something.
And that's it. I believe I'm done here! Wow, I wasn't expecting this to be a 23-minute long video, that's for sure! (Darn you, stage 3...)
Aw, nuts. My shield broke. Now my life bar is vulnerable for several seconds. Try to dodge enemy fire as best you can until the shield comes back!
Whoops. I killed a chair. Well, this run's not gonna be a 0% destruction run...
Maybe I have to seek out the last lingering enemies in the stage?

So, here's the config menu to start off with. It contains control options, obviously, but it also has this option near the bottom, and I'm not sure what it does. I'll just leave it as what it was initially set to.
Okay, now the fight with Marisa begins for real, but why hasn't this writing table keeled over yet? (This is why it would've been nice if there were visible boss life bars.)
Demo count: 1
Alright, where's that last piece of trash?
...Once this conversation ends, that is.
Oh, man. My shield is down and the boss is approaching!
When you've destroyed all of the trash in the room, the pink percentage will change to the word "BOSS", and it'll be boss time!
Oy, how long am I going to be stuck in stage 3 here?
Okay, my shield's back. Now, let's resume table trashing! (Man, I wish bosses had a visible life meter in this game.)
Yeah! Full destruction!
First, let's do Normal.
Same deal as before. Destroy the trash, but try to avoid destroying the other stuff.
You do not want to get caught in that! (Unless you're barrel rolling, of course.)
Okay, now let's try not to destroy things that aren't trash or enemies...
However, we do have to wait through several seconds of dialog before the next phase of the fight begins, unfortunately. (But this does give your shield and magic time to recover, which is nice.)
Oh, and there's another heart, and...
Oh, if you're wondering about the "20/20" (or sometimes it shows "19/20" or lower) in the lower-right, I believe that's the frame rate, with "20/20" being ideal.

Also, the score down there usually shows "00" during a stage, and killing regular enemies doesn't increase it, but I have seen it increase by low amounts during stages on occasion. However, the bulk of the points comes from the stage clear bonuses, and any mid-stage increases are nearly trivial.

Also, while barrel rolling, you temporarily lose control of your movement, and will keep moving wherever you were moving, regardless of where you move the mouse. However, a barrel roll could save your life if you're in a jam and your shield is down.
...Marisa again! But, she's far harder than she was before!
WRAAAH!!! I'M GONNA WRECK IT!
Okay, there's writing table #1. Let's destroy it without being utterly destroyed ourselves!
Okay, round two begins! And Marisa's not holding back!
That Master Spark just barely nicked my shield. I'm still good.
Oh! The stage is finally over! Honestly, this stage takes way too long to clear, since you have to wait for three writing tables.
Treasure chests always contain hearts, so you can break them open if you need a guaranteed life recovery. However, those chests still count as things you want to avoid destroying.
Okay, on the ending screen, click once to get a "Thank you for playing!" message and then return to the stage select screen.
Left-clicking will either cause Flandre to wield a sword or shoot lasers, depending on whether you click inside or outside of the white circle. (Inside=Sword. Outside=Laser.)
Here comes the writing table boss, but I'd better be careful, since my shield is down, and you've seen how fast the game can kill me on Easy!
Whew! I'm surprised that it didn't turn me into swiss cheese there! Okay, now on Hard mode, your life bonus is 5000 x life remaining.
Bah. Destroyed part of that bookshelf by accident. That sword is kind of risky to use near furniture.
Alright, if this writing table doesn't end the stage upon its destruction, I'm going to speed up some of this footage to ludicrous speed until I win.

Alright, it's time for another Touhou flash game, and this time, it's "Sweeping Murder"! This game was suggested to me by Yellowpikachu1 not too long ago, and while I have played this one before, I was debating whether or not to make a video of it. And, eventually, I decided to.
Okay, now let's kill writing table #2...
WHUUUUUUT?!?!?!

If your shield becomes completely depleted, it'll break for several seconds. During this time, any hits you take will reduce your life (upper-left), and unlike the other two bars, that one doesn't recover over time. If your life bar empties, you lose.

Wow, so much destruction. The goal, at least right now, is to get rid of the trash objects which are outlined in red. Other things, like furniture, are not your primary targets, but can certainly be destroyed.
Man, these enemies are really annoying. Get out of my face!

Oh, another thing: If you press the X button, Flandre will do a barrel roll (seriously!). Her sprite will kind of flip back and forth, and during that short time, you won't be hurt by attacks. However, this consumes magic, and can't be used in rapid succession.
Oh, man. Here it comes!
Okay, I found the last trash bag. Now, it's boss time, against...

However, YouTube's video description character limit really got in my way there, so I had to limit what else I was saying in it, and trim out some white space (like indents) from the manual translation. Right now, I'm exactly one character under the limit!
Oh, geez. Not good. Run!
Actually, I don't think I can attack Marisa during the dialogue, so I should concentrate on the writing table at the moment.
But... That was too easy. Yep, it's not over yet.
Okay, there was a heart in that bookshelf.
The lower-left corner has the usual quality setting, and then there's the manual, which is all in Japanese.
Now, I think I remember reading somewhere that you get a different ending if you manage to clear all five stages with 0% library damage. I certainly didn't accomplish that here...
Cool. I won with only 2% library damage. That gives me a score that's "OVER 9000!!!"
Argh!!! I took my eyes off of my life gauge for just a couple seconds there!
Well, let's try that again...
Alright, and now for the final stage, which is pretty much just a boss battle.
As usual, try to minimize damage to the library. If an object takes a hit but doesn't break, it won't count against you.
Oh, man. They've got Flan-seeking missiles! Maybe I should consider doing a barrel roll?
Oh, so that brown thing is what's shooting the missiles. Okay.
Let's see what my overall destruction rating is...
Man, this writing table must have a lot of HP or something... Speaking of HP, I could use some.
Alright, I'm angry now, and I'm just going to trash the place on purpose!
Also, I don't care that I scored -9640. I don't want to repeat that stage. Let's move on to stage 4.
And that's game! Marisa's defeated for good this time!
